TopicTitle: (Editor) is there a way to see current FSM state during testing?

Articles.Content:
When testing a run through a mission in the mission editor, it would be really helpful to be able to see which state of the state machine it is currently sitting in.  I think that would help me debug a lot of problems.  But I'm not sure how to do this.  Is there a feature that will show me this?

It would be the state-machine equivalent of when a debugger highlights the current line of code as you step through a program.

I suspect a lot of my problems are that the state machine isn't in the state I thought it would be at this point in the mission, but I don't know which state it's actually in instead of the one I expected.

Edited March 23, 2018 by Steven Mading

If you mark every node as an objective I’m thinking you could track it that way. Then remove the ones just for tracking in the play version of your Mission. 

Advice from a Mission Builder enthusiast  beyond my abilities .
